Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jbalboa
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my visit to this hotel. I did not have a reservation, and I arrived very late in the evening, the girl greeted me with a warm smile and helped me get a room to get some rest. The room was much nicer than I had expected. Breakfast was a wonderful treat. I will be back to this establishment in the future

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mseera
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, looked quite new. Room key card was already prepared during arrival. Got laundry done, reasonable price for good service. Easy to find, with many shopping and attractions nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Garrett S
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with nice people to deal with. Good breakfast. Not a knock against the hotel, but I had an allergic reaction to the sheets. Kept awake through the night, stupid me, should have covered the pillow with a t-shirt. Again, not the hotels fault, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Service Shined”
Reviews.Author: DLWeber67
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all my expectations. The hotel was very clean & the rooms comfortable. The fitness room had more equipment than I had previously experienced. My midnight arrival was no problem

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SLLColorado
Reviews.Content: I prefer Holiday In Express hotels for the price and amenities. This one is as nice as the others I have stayed in. The hotel was in a perfect location for our stay, the facility was clean, the beds were comfortable, free wifi was nice, and the continental breakfast was good. I enjoyed the pool and hot tub, which were clean and at a great temperature. The staff was friendly and efficient. One thing to consider is that our room was on the freeway side, which we could hear once the air conditioning was turned off, but it did not bother me at all because we were so tired after running around all day. If that is a concern for you, you might want to ask for a room on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical for the Chain”
Reviews.Author: llsee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October while returning home from vacation. This is a slightly older Holiday Inn Express, and it is showing some wear around the edges. Our room, was on the first floor on the interstate 10 side of the hotel. I was a little worried about road noise, but it was not a problem. While there was some noise from the highway, once the blackout curtains were closed it was barely noticeable. The room was clean, if a bit worn. The bed was comfortable and we slept well. The complimentary breakfast was standard for HIE hotels, and was almost identical to other hotels in the chain. The coffee was better than normal and I was willing to forgo my usual $bucks run.

Reviews.Title: “good solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkm55
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this location pretty regularly for 5 years. It's clean, comfortable, and a good value for the money, especially during the summer. The staff is professional and effiecient, easy access to I10, and within walking distance to a Cracker Barrel. One really ncie thing is if you have a reservaiton, the a/c is turned on before you get there. this a great touch when the temps are in triple digits. Internet is easy to hook up to but during busy times can be slow. Breakfast is normal HIE hot fare and a great value. My last stay here the hot water was not very hot, not bad enough to complain about but noticeable. if your on the road looking for a clean comfortable hotel with good value this is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Average”
Reviews.Author: chheal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Friday night of Labor Day weekend. At check-in, I asked to be located away from the very busy highway and was assured that I would be. I didn't even check when I got to the room as I trusted the friendly, but not very competent desk clerk. When the air in the room shut off, surprise - road noise and lots of it!! The room was pretty good and it was nice to have a refrigerator in the room. It was clean and new and the beds were supportive and newer. BUT, the internet overloaded in the evening and I experienced multiple timed out connections before just giving up. We also had noise issues that were partly due to the inexpensive construction of the hotel and partly due to the fact that many people just use no manners or restraint no matter the hour. We won't stay again based on the internet problem, but the room quality and cleanliness were good if you have no internet needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 25 minutes from the airport and is located close to great restaurants, shopping and movie theaters. It is in a very clean and nice neighborhood. You are warmly greeted by the front desk staff who are brisk, efficient and exudes an aura of welcome. They take all requests, no matter how large or small, seriously and work quickly to satisfy your needs. Being a frequent guest (between 100 and 200 nights the last 3 years!), I have stayed in a variety of rooms and ALL of them are very clean and comfortable. A selection of pillows from soft to hard ensure a good nights sleep. The rooms on one side face the highway but the distance and insulation damps out all the noise. Even if you get a room on the highway side, don’t worry, you will sleep well. The air conditioners in all the rooms I stayed in, work well and are a welcome relief from the hot days of Arizona. There is a small fridge and microwave in each room. The bathrooms are well stocked with the usual toiletries. I love the showers in this hotel. A hard day’s work and weary bodies are rejuvenated in the rain like shower. The towels are high quality and very nice. The pool is nice and it is well used In the heat of the Arizona summer. They have a hot tub too, but I have not used this. However, much to my surprise, I have seen guests use this in the peak of summer! Must be Santa's elves from the north pole enjoying the heat! There is a small exercise room on the fourth floor. It has a couple of weight machines, two treadmills and a stair stepper. Not the best, but adequate while on a trip. For those serious exercise buffs, there is a LA Fitness within walking distance and for those of you who are members of the YMCA, there are 2 located within 5 miles of the hotel. They have an excellent selection of food for breakfast. I love the brand new pancake machine. Press the button and a couple of hot, perfectly cooked pancakes pop out after a minute or so. They have placed the syrup, butter etc conveniently next to this machine – feels like home – maybe not, no machine at home, I have to do them myself! Being a road warrior, who travels the world, I can confidently state whenever I come across a great hotel, the management behind the scenes ensures the whole operation is guest focused. Ollie Smith, the manager is to be lauded for the operation she runs. Ollie and her team of dedicated staff make the hardship of being away from home that much easier to bear. I wish every hotel I stay in was like this Holiday Inn Express. Safe journeys fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine”
Reviews.Author: anon0423
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the HIE for two nights, I can safely say that the rooms are fine, the service was fine, and the location was fine. While is nothing special about this hotel, it is clean, relatively affordable, and has more amenities than one might expect out of a HIE. The breakfast selection was awful (the buffet included seriously expired cartons of yogurt and very tired fruit), but one doesn't stay at a HIE expecting a gourmet dining experience. The pillows are fantastic (hard and soft available in room). Just fine for a business travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travphil
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights. $30 cab ride from Sky Harbor Airport. Easy access from I 10. Rented car from Elliot Rd. using Hertz' "pickup and drop off" service as the airport costs $150 more with added surcharges and taxes. Hotel was excellent. Clean, comfortable beds and pillows, friendly staff, good breakfast, 24hr coffee, adequate parking, feels safe and number of gas stations, restaurants and fast food places nearby. Only set back was slower Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Snoodles1322
Reviews.Content: very nice room, employees were friendly and helpfull. the best continental breakfast ever. great location to highway and airport

Reviews.Title: “Built for business not families”
Reviews.Author: adirondacks14
Reviews.Content: We stay a lot at Holiday Inn Express and usually like the hotels. We will not stay at this hotle again when returning and would recommend families not to stay here. Cons: 1. We were told there are only King bed rooms available not facing the noisy interstate. This will leave most families (2 Queen bed rooms) on the noisy side of the hotel. We turned on the fan to drown out the noise. The AC when it kicks on is very loud. They were unflexible in accommodating room preference such as being on higher floors and also facing away from the interstate. 2. No side or back entrances. You can only enter or leave the hotel by two front exits. This included handicap parking located on the side entrances away front entrances which is unusual for most hotels. 3. Although smoking is prohibited inside the hotel (Which was in forced), they do seem to allow smoking in the front and next to pool area. Some smokers were polite and moved farther away when our kids were in the pool area but others sat out and smoked away making guest who were at the pool breathe in 2nd hand smoke. Also it seemed this was a cocktail area with people drinking beers and smoking. Not really a good family atmosphere. 4. Only 1 washer and 2 dryers located on floor 3. 5. The receptionists need to work on providing friendlier service. 6. Breakfast food did run out one day when a swim team came down and cleared it out. We came back down about an hour later and it was restocked. Holiday Inn Express seem to have more teams and groups staying at them because they offer group discounts. 7. Small breakfast area - you may need to take the food on run. 8. No usual cookies except for one night out five. Pros: 1. Except for the noisy interstate, the room was pretty quiet. The doors are very heavy and close loud. I think the hotel was not very busy but I only heard the doors closing outside the room a few times and didn't hear any noise from the other rooms except when walking down the hall. 2. Comfortable beds. 3. Pretty pool. Jacuzzi can't stay warm enough once the sun goes down but I figure this is Phoenix weather and most of the time people prefer it a little cooler in the pools. Pool is clean but heavy in chlorine so bring the googles and moisturizer. 4. Clean rooms, hallways and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KB303
Reviews.Content: We were visiting relatives in the Chandler area and wanted to stay at a hotel nearby their home. So glad we found the Holiday Inn Express. It was extremely clean and the room was very comfortable. Housekeeping staff was superb. The only thing I found lacking was the breakfast in the morning. When we arrived downstairs, there was no coffee, no eggs left and two-three slices of bacon swimming in grease. There was cold cereal, but no spoons to eat the cereal. I asked at the front desk for spoons and the girl behind the desk was quite annoyed with the interruption. Skip the breakfast and head to the Cracker Barrel down the street which was excellent (food and service fantastic).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: erniegirard
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel after everything in Phoenix was booked up for some convention that was going on downtown. I was tired and desperate for a room so I gave it a shot. The guy who checked me in at the front desk was very friendly, they gave me two free bottles of water when I checked in. The room was not big, I had two queen beds (only thing available) but it looked like there was really only adequate room for a king. However, my criticism ends there. Bed was clean and comfortable, the room was in great shape. Free wifi was really fast. Late checkout available. Bathroom was in great condition. Overall this hotel did not seem brand new, but new enough that it was in great condition. I would have no reservations staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard contemporary business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingComputerGuy
Reviews.Content: It's not a hotel that will take your breath away when you step into the reception area or the room, but it's clean and has modern appointments. The staff is efficient and well versed, even if not outwardly friendly. The hotel is just off the I-10, in a decent area, surrounded by all the regular trappings of a metropolitan area (restaurants of all types, shopping centers, a mall, etc). My room had a small microwave and fridge, a welcome sight for my week-long stay. The styling is modern and seems new enough. Breakfast is light and usually has something hot like eggs bacon and/or sausage as well as the normal cereals and breads. Only two things I didn't like about the hotel were: - The AC unit in my room was hideously loud and obnoxious. I found the only way i could sleep through the night was to crank it as cold as it would go and then turn it off before I went to bed. - The "high-speed" internet is absolutely atrocious. Speeds rivaling that of the golden-age of dial-up modem and latencies well into the 2500ms range. It was useless except to lightly browse web-pages and check email. It had me looking into a wireless Aircard for laptop it was so bad. All said and done, it's a nice hotel for the money and a short stay. If you're a network heavy user that requires crisp data flow, you may be better off looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ejody
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot-- all over the U.S. and worldwide. I've stayed in jungles and deserts, in dumps and palaces, in extreme luxury and in places that make Gilligan's Island look like the Ritz-Carlton... so I bring a little perspective here. I've generally found Holiday Inn Express to be decent and clean, but this one in Chandler (a suburb of Phoenix, 15 minutes from Sky Harbor Airport) was above and beyond in every respect. Earlier reviews (2006 and prior) indicate it was in need of a remodel. Well it got one and it is fantastic. My king room was huge, high ceilings, beautiful furnishings including a great desk, nice sofa and chairs, refrigerator, and very nice bath with large tub/shower and great towels. The bed was extremely comfortable (wish mine was so nice), and the decor was very tasteful. Very clean too. The lobby was also tastefully decorated and the complimentary breakfast was quite good and filling. Lots of choices: fresh scrambled eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, several cereals, many types of muffins and baked breads, several yogurts, milk, juices, coffee, tea, etc. And did I mention it was complimentary? As if this isn't enough, there's a Cracker Barrel (my favorite) within walking distance. The hotel was also quiet. My room faced the busy freeway but the windows were very well-insulated and I didn't hear a thing. Free high-speed wireless internet was a very nice plus. Also USA Today every morning. Also free. Staff was very friendly-- always said hello, good morning or evening as I walked through the lobby to my room. I'd stay there again in a second (and will be back in the area soon-- looking forward to it.) What's not to like? All that for only $100/night. A GREAT deal! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel if a bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: Welshcowboy
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we thought the Hotel was a little out of the way howevere with Trips to Old Tuscon and the Prima Air Museum it was ideally placed for both - and indeed for ventures into Scottsville. The Hotel appeared modern with nice rooms which were clean and airy. Breakfast was good with a reasonable choice. We certainly had no complaints and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: BeJerky
Reviews.Content: I was in town to do some work at Intel and decided to stay at the Holiday Inn Express since they had a good Intel rate and because I would get Priority Club points. The hotel had been undergoing some renovations with more planned in the near future. The exterior of the hotel looked good and my room was large and clean. The wired Internet worked great and the bathroom was nice and clean. Breakfast was not spectacular, but good and even had a few hot items. The exercise room had several aerobic machines (including 2 treadmills) and all appeared to be working order. I did not make use of the pool and jacuzzi, but they looked very inviting. The staff was friendly and helpful. Several restaurants were within a 5-10 minute drive and there was a Cracker Barrel just down the driveway from the hotel. I would stay again if I return to Chandler.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: OurTwins
Reviews.Content: In January 2007, my husband and I dared to travel to Arizona with our 19 month old twins. On January 15th we stayed here in Chandler. The front desk was informative, polite and gave us an upgrade for free! I couldn't complain about that! The room had a nice view over the outdoor pool, plenty of space for our little ones to run around, very nice bed. That night, my daughter got an upset stomach and was up most of the night. At checkout the staff was awesome with the problems that had occurred and were completely understood.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here and it was one night too many. I think there were probably nicer rooms in the motel but we were not lucky enough to receive one of those rooms. Our room had a one inch crack below the door....everything was old and dingy looking and it didn't feel clean. The bed was comfortable however, we slept out of pure exhaustion even over the highway noise. The pool area was nice and we enjoyed that very much. Next time coming into town we will make sure we know where we are going and will book ahead. Don't be fooled by the pretty lobby, or at least look to see the room you are being assigned. There are lots of nicer newer motels at the next exit west.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Chandler - Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 15221 S 50th St, Phoenix, AZ 85044
